remarks.para: The global functions include public methods that extend Javascript's abilities, as well as private methods necessary for jsObjects.
The common.js functions can be used without uiCommon.js functions -- but not vice versa.

member.name: replace (string, string, string)
member.summary: Returns a string in which a specified substring has been replaced with another substring. Easier to use then the Javascript replace method of the string type.
member.param: Required. String expression containing substring to replace.

member.name: objectEvent (object, string, string)
member.summary: Creates and fires the specified DOM event on the specified object on the page. Works with both IE and Mozilla.
member.param: Required. The object the event is to be fire on.
Required. The text name of the event. Example: click, blur. Accepts both IE and Mozilla event names (blur OR onBlur)
Optional. The user's current browser. Pass "IE" or "MOZ" or leave blank and the browser will be determined by the function.
member.returns: Boolean indicating whether or not the event fired sucessfully.

member.name: getAllDescendants(object, string)
member.summary: Returns an array of descendants (children, grandchildren, etc) for a given DOM object, of a specified type. Similar to IE's "document.all" but cross-browser compatible.
member.param: Required. The DOM object to start the search at. Pass document.body to start at the top of the DOM.
Optional. The tag name for the type of descendants to find. Pass "ALL" or leave empty to find all descendants regardless of tag name.
member.returns: An array of all matching descendant objects.

member.name: getHost(string)
member.summary: Returns only the host name of a given URL. Useful to pre-check links for security issues.
member.returns: A string containing the host name.

member.name: HTMLEncode(string)
member.summary: Encodes HTML for transmission via XML, replacing tags with their respective entities.

member.name: getQueryString(string)
member.summary: Parses a URL to extract query string parameters into a quickly accessible object. Similar to the Request.QueryString method in ASP.
member.param: Optional. The URL to be parsed. If left blank, the current document's location will be used.
member.returns: An object containing a property for each query string parameter.

member.name: serializeObject(object/array)
member.summary: Turns a Javascript object into valid XML describing that object.
member.param: The Javascript Object or Array to be described.
member.returns: An XML string describing the Object or Array.
member.remarks: Warning. Do not use this function on a DOM object, as those objects appear to be recursive in some way, and will cause this function to loop continuously. Use only on pure Javascript Objects or Arrays.

member.name: getFormData(object)
member.summary: Parses all form elements, and corresponding values, on a page into a nested Javascript object.
member.param: Optional. The DOM object to start parsing at. If left blank document.body will be used.
member.returns: A nested Object representing all form elements and values on the page.
member.remarks: Can be used in conjunction with serializeObject to allow XML transmission of form data.

member.name: xmlDecode(string)
member.summary: Decodes XML (or HTML) that has been encoded by having it's tags changed to entities for transmission as an XML node value. Restores encoded data.
member.param: The encoded (entity-replaced) XML (or HTML) to be decoded.
member.remarks: This is the opposite of the HTMLEncode function.
